trans-unit.source: Retrieves the size of a given window's client area.

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the size of a given window's client area.

target.mrk: Retrieves the size of a given window's client area.

trans-unit.source: The title/hWnd/class of the window to get the size. See Title special definition.

seg-source.mrk: The title/hWnd/class of the window to get the size.

target.mrk: The title/hWnd/class of the window to get the size.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The text of the window to get the size. Default is an empty string. See Text special definition.

seg-source.mrk: The text of the window to get the size.

target.mrk: The text of the window to get the size.

trans-unit.source: a 2-element array containing the following information:

seg-source.mrk: a 2-element array containing the following information:

target.mrk: a 2-element array containing the following information:

trans-unit.source: sets the @error flag to non-zero if the window is not found.

seg-source.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero if the window is not found.

target.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero if the window is not found.

trans-unit.source: If the window is minimized, the returned width and height values are both zero. However, WinGetClientSize() works correctly on (non-minimized) hidden windows. If the window title "Program Manager" is used, the function will return the size of the desktop. If multiple windows match the criteria, the most recently active window is used.

seg-source.mrk: If the window is minimized, the returned width and height values are both zero.
However, WinGetClientSize() works correctly on (non-minimized) hidden windows.
If the window title "Program Manager" is used, the function will return the size of the desktop.
If multiple windows match the criteria, the most recently active window is used.

target.mrk: If the window is minimized, the returned width and height values are both zero.
However, WinGetClientSize() works correctly on (non-minimized) hidden windows.
If the window title "Program Manager" is used, the function will return the size of the desktop.
If multiple windows match the criteria, the most recently active window is used.

trans-unit.source: Wait 10 seconds for the Notepad window to appear.

seg-source.mrk: Wait 10 seconds for the Notepad window to appear.

target.mrk: Wait 10 seconds for the Notepad window to appear.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the client area of the Notepad window using the handle returned by WinWait.

seg-source.mrk: Retrieve the client area of the Notepad window using the handle returned by WinWait.

target.mrk: Retrieve the client area of the Notepad window using the handle returned by WinWait.

trans-unit.source: Display the height and width of the client area.

seg-source.mrk: Display the height and width of the client area.

target.mrk: Display the height and width of the client area.

trans-unit.source: Close the Notepad window using the handle returned by WinWait.

seg-source.mrk: Close the Notepad window using the handle returned by WinWait.

target.mrk: Close the Notepad window using the handle returned by WinWait.
